overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a structured approach to forecasting 96-hour HUFL data using 4-day historical data. It begins by assessing data completeness and seasonality patterns, evaluates multiple modeling options (SARIMA, seasonal naive, averaging), and selects a simple averaging method due to limited data and absence of clear trends. The approach emphasizes practical implementation with data rounding and formatting considerations.
common_data_patterns: Variation in hourly patterns across days
Absence of clear trend in daily averages
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) prevents modeling weekly seasonality or complex trends
Averaging same-hour values across days creates a stable daily profile for multi-day forecasting
Rounding forecasted values to match original data precision (3 decimals) is critical
Seasonal naive models may underperform when daily patterns vary significantly
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines statistical analysis (seasonality detection, stationarity consideration) with practical simplifications due to data constraints, ending with straightforward implementation.
